results.title: The Russians
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Russians”.
A three part series examining life in the Soviet Union. This episode studies Kierov, Kuban, Belarussia and Siberia. Narrated by Nick Tate, cinematography by Dean Semler.

results.title: The Russian consumer
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Discusses the Russian consumer and the prices of the goods and housing availability. After decades of development at the expense of the consumer the Soviet economy now provides a higher standard of living, however, improvements remain out of reach of most of the peasants.

results.title: The Russia house
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Paul Maslansky and Panthe Entertainment
results.brief_description: When Katya (Michelle Pfeiffer), a beautiful Russian book editor attempts to send British publisher Barley Blair (Sean Connery) a manuscript written by “Dante” (Klaus Maria Brandauer), a noted scientist, she unwittingly involves him in a world of international espionage. The explosive manuscript - which, if published in the West could dramatically alter the global balance of world power - is intercepted by the West’s spy-masters, who then send Blair to Russia to gain more information on the mysterious manuscript. But when Blair, who has a deep affection for Russia and its people finds himself falling in love with the beautiful Katya, he must decide whose side he really is on. This adaptation of a novel by John Le Carre was scripted by playwright Tom Stoppard. It features a score by Jerry Goldsmith with Brandon Marsalis as a soloist. Other cast members include James Fox, Roy Scheider, J. T. Walsh and John Mahoney. (Awards: Golden Globe 1991: best actress for Michelle Pfeiffer)

results.title: The Running man (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Paul Michael Glaser, George Linder, Tim Zinnemann, Keith Barish Productions and Taft Entertainment
results.brief_description: The year is 2019. All that has survived of the 20th century is television. Television in a new and twisted fashion where the most powerful program on the air is a high-stakes, high-tech game show. “The Running man” is a deadly futuristic cat and mouse carnival in which contestants battle for the ultimate prize - survival! Based on the novel by Richard Backhman, this was rated one of the best action movies of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Michael Glaser, George Linder, Tim Zinnemann, Keith Barish Productions and Taft Entertainment

results.title: The Running broad jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The technique of long jumping is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Provides an analysis of the movements and the physical forces that are significant features of this event; shows single “hitch kick” action and outlines training programs and practices to aid the beginner.

results.title: The Runner
results.creator_credit: Amir Naderi, Alireza Zarrin and Inst for the Intellectual Development of Children and Young Adults
results.brief_description: Buoyed by an extraordinary performance from Majid Nirumand, “Runner” is an evocative, memorable slice of life drama about an orphaned street kid who lives alone on a beached boat on the edge of the Persian Gulf and who, as the film progresses, attempts a variety of jobs to survive. The first post-revolution Iranian film to be released internationally, Naderi’s film is a beautifully photographed, deceptively simple film which is decidedly sophisticated in the ways it changes mood. Raw in parts, upbeat in others, Runner brilliantly uses striking images and sound to take you right into Amiro’s world. Winner of the International Critics Prize at the Melbourne Film Festival.

results.title: The Runaways
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
A tale of childhood romance about the 9-year-old Harry Walmers and his fiance, both guests at the Holly Tree Inn, who elope with the help fo the hostess, Mrs Piff, Boots and the other servants. Introductor narration filmed in Dickens’ home.

results.title: The Runaway Brain
results.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Planet for the Taking”.
This programme asks the central question, can we begin to see ourselves not as dominant but as integral, as just one part of the complex pattern of matter and life. Host David Suzuki talks to some of the world’s greatest thinkers about whether science and technology can solve the problems they have created.

results.title: The Rumour of true things
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Most of the moving images produced for science, industry, commerce and medicine are seen only by specialised audiences and are then discarded soon after they are made.

The Rumour of True Things’ is constructed entirely from such moving images ephemera, including computer games, weapons testing, production lines, monitoring and marriage agency tapes.The Rumour of True Things’ is a remarkable anthropological portrait of a technologically-based society obsessed with imaging itself.

Taken from PROOF exhibition November 2004
